intro: Campylocentrum panamense, commonly known as the Panama starfruit, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are typically orange in color and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is cultivated in some regions for both aesthetic and culinary purposes.
